intro: Bunium fontanesii var. mauritanicum, commonly known as the Mauritania fennel, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a strong, pungent odor when crushed. This variety is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
